intro: Senecio conterminus, commonly known as the narrowleaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and open woodlands. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Senecio conterminus is adapted to drought conditions and is often found in disturbed or dry habitats.
